alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 09 at 8:11PM CDT until June 10 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Illinois River at Chewey affecting Adair, Cherokee and Delaware Counties. ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Illinois River near Tahlequah affecting Cherokee County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Illinois River near Tahlequah. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, minor flooding occurs from near Hanging Rock downstream towards Tahlequah. Floating the river is too hazardous due to strong turbulence. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 9.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is cresting currently at 9.5 feet and will fall tonight back below action stage. However, additional rainfall is expected in the basin late tonight into Friday morning, and will cause the river to rise back above action stage to a crest of 10.3 feet Saturday evening. The river will then fall back below action stage by Sunday evening and will remain below action stage thereafter. - Action stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
